name: Joseph Bernard
text: Had the goat it was delightful, this was my first experience eating curried goat as well as plantains. The plantains reminded me very much of sweet potatoes in both taste and texture. The goat was spicy enough that one could enjoy the heat without being overwhelmed. I opted for the beans and rice to go with it as well as the french fries. Fries were perfect and the rice with beans were everything I expected and more. Tried two different sodas the Koala Champagne had an interesting flavor. All in all looking forward to my next outing here want to eat jerk chicken next.

name: John Whitfield
text:
Food was outstanding.
Everything was well prepared and perfectly seasoned.
The staff was charming, pleasant and knowledgeable
Looking forward to coming back for more oxtails over yellow rice.

name: Brandy Stephens
text: The curry chicken was great! It was ready right away, too. I ordered the small portion but I had enough to bring some home. I'll go back to try the rest of the menu 😋

name: Roscoe Woods
text: Well done authentic jerked chicken. Great Mac n cheese too!  Just passing by and stopped in, well worth it!

name: Katara
text: I’ve been waiting for Baldwin County to open a great Jamaican spot and I can testify that they honestly did not disappoint. Truly satisfying, please go try it

name: Angela Casey
text: I broke my fast to try "The Jamaican Spot".. I don't regret it one bit🤣! They definitely brought Jamaica to Loxley, Alabama! Food was fresh and hot, seasoned perfectly!

name: Amanda Lott
text: Service was great but the food is amazing. The meat was so tender you could cut it with a plastic fork. I don't believe I've tasted Jamaican food this authentic since actually being in Jamaica

name: Brendan Abel
text: Food was great! Worth the trip from the interstate if you want something besides a chain restaurant in the area

name: Cliana Byrd
text: The food was wonderful and delicious
